verb.description: Refer to something briefly and without going into detail.
examples: I haven't mentioned it to William yet
I mentioned that my father was meeting me later

noun.description: A reference to someone or something.
examples: their eyes light up at a mention of Sartre
she made no mention of her disastrous trip to Paris

phrases: Oh, that, don't mention it, said Karen, with a chuckle.
No, don't mention it; I'm sorry I knocked you over.
Please don't mention it, Vicki snapped slightly.
Aw, don't mention it, I said, trying to sound cheerful.
Man, don't mention it; what are friends for?
origin: Middle English (originally in make mention of): via Old French from Latin mentio(n-); related to mind.
